Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän! There's a storm coming!
What? How can you tell?
I can just feel it in my bones. Vertrau mir.

Fields.MenuText: I don't know if I can trust "a feeling in your bones."
My grandmother used to say the same thing, so I believe you!
Sure... let's go with that.

Fields.DialogueText: But it's never been wrong before!
We need to get ready, then!
I dislike your hesitation, but as long as you believe me, I guess it's fine.
Wait, Hannah... what reason do I have to completely believe you?
I'm your friend, aren't I? Please just trust me. I wouldn't say this unless I was absolutely sure.
I believe you. How big is it going to be? What do you suggest we do?
Well, first I think we need to fight those Nixen on the horizon, they're getting a little too close for comfort. We'll still have time to deal with the storm.
Then let's get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Maybe we can get through the combat before the storm hits.
Vielleicht...
Hello, Hannah!
Hallo, Kapitän! I'm so glad you've been learning to be more punctual!
I've learned not to keep you waiting, I guess.
See what a good influence I am on you?
So, tell me. Why did you want to meet here?
Ah! I wanted to attach some Stützbleche to the masts of the ship, just in case another storm comes.
That seems reasonable.
Halt mal!
Oh, we're doing this now. All right, then.
You know, Hannah, you're quite the wonder when it comes to mechanics and any other handiwork. Did it take you long to develop your skills?
What, you don't think I was born with these amazing skill intact? How do you think I got so good?

Fields.MenuText: Actually, you probably could convince me that it all came naturally to you.
Probably hard work and practice?
Trick question! You're not that good.

Fields.DialogueText: Schön wär's! That would've made Hans's life so much easier. And less deadly.
Jepp! Fortunately, I love the work and Hans was a decently fast learner, so it wasn't too difficult.
Haha, sehr witzig. It's a wonder anyone even lets me be the wrench wench.
Well, you've impressed me. And isn't that what counts?
Heh, I'm so glad to have impressed eure Königliche Hoheit.
Look like we're going to have to cut this conversation short. Otherwise, this ship is going to end up in even worse condition.
Then I'll just have more to repair. Das wäre lästig.
Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Hm? What's this? Why are there footprints all over the deck?
Keine Ahnung. What a strange happening. I'm going to go find the culprit behind this!
Hannah... why are the bottoms of your shoes covered in grease?
What a crazy accusation! Ich würde doch niemals... actually, that's a lie. I definitely would. I promise I only noticed it five seconds before you did! I would never do this intentionally.

Fields.MenuText: This is quite the mess. How about I help you clean it up?
How could you do this to my deck? You really should've noticed earlier, especially since you've been doing so much work in the engine room!
How about we just have one of the swabbies do it? You're a very busy woman.

Fields.DialogueText: Das wäre wirklich nett. Must be a thousand prints...
Technically it's my deck... but honestly it's a wonder this sort of thing doesn't happen more often.
Heh, I'm sure I can handle the cleanup myself.
Well, I'll go pick up the cleaning supplies. Be back in a second, Hannah.
Danke, Kapitän. Not many Kapitäne would be so helpful.
I try to be. Oh! The Morganas are back. I guess we'll have to postpone the cleaning. Maybe if we throw the grease overboard, the Morganas will slip on it?
Doubtful.
@BATTLE
The Morganas are making their way to the ship! We need to make sure we're ready!
@BATTLE
Was soll das heißen, das Schiff ist zu langsam? I've been working on that engine for weeks! It's practically perfect!
Hannah, remember what I told you.
In through the nose and out through the mouth...
In through the nose and out through the mouth...
I don't see how this is supposed to help. I'm still angry.
Is there anything that helps you calm down?
Screaming at the people who've made me angry.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, yes. Doesn't that make us all feel better?
Maybe you could try counting backwards from ten and then reevaluating the situation.
How about you try forcing yourself to walk away? Remove yourself from the infuriating situation.

Fields.DialogueText: Vermutlich.
Pah, so ein Humbug!
I don't know if I could just walk away from something like that.
You need to find something that works for you.
I guess I'll go work on the engine some more. Lenkt mich ab.
Give it a go. You love to do it anyway!
I'll see you later, Kapitän. Let me know if you need me to do anything!
Hannah? Are you in there?
Nein!
Hannah, can I come in? I need to talk to you about something!
All right, just one second! I need to put some stuff away.
All right now?
Ja, ja.
Hannah...
Ja?
What did you need to put away?
Nothing important, so don't worry about it.

Fields.MenuText: All right...
Tell me!
Are you sure I shouldn't worry about it?

Fields.DialogueText: Psst!
It's not even that big of a deal!
Positiv! There's nothing going on in here.
You're acting so suspiciously...
... Anyway, I just need you to come up on deck. There's work to be done.
Captain! The Morganas are back!
Aren't they always? Get ready for battle!
@BATTLE
Hannah? What's that you have there?
K–Kapitän! Don't look!
Wait, wait! Was that what you hid from me earlier? Don't hide it! Can you please show me what it is?
Fine. It's just a notebook filled with a bunch of my ideas.
Ah, are you our ship's resident Leonardo di Vinci?
Nichts Besonderes. There are some inventions, but also music and writing and some other stuff.

Fields.MenuText: Can you tell me about some of the inventions you've thought of?
What kind of writing do you do?
What do you mean by music?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, this one is a plan for a Raumschiff.
Some poetry, some Kurzgeschichten. They're all terrible, though. Heh.
Lyrics from songs I like, lyrics I came up with you, et cetera.
Just when I think I have you all figured out, Hannah, you surprise me with something new. I had no idea you were so creative.
Nicht? But...
Oh, don't look so downcast. I meant it as a compliment!
Achso...
Captain! Morganas are headed this way!
We'll be right there!
@BATTLE
A... what?
Raum... space... a spaceship!
Hello, Hannah! Hannah? Where are you?
What is it, Kapitän?
I just wanted to say hello. Is there something wrong with that?
Nein.
You seem very... off today.
... Hannah?
You insulted me! You really didn't think I was creative?!
Whoa, Hannah! Calm down!
Das könnte dir so passen! This is your fault!
Hannah, I didn't mean it like that! It was my poor attempt at humor – I had no doubt you're a creative person.
... Really?

Fields.MenuText: Absolutely!
I mean, your creativity expresses itself in odd ways, to be sure...
... No, not really.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, ha, ha... I knew this was all some big misunderstanding!
I'm just going to let that go and move on.
Another poor attempt at humor?
Morganas, Hannah! We need to get the crew together, and fast!
@BATTLE
Where in the world is that music coming from? Is it coming from Hannah's cabin?! Hello, Hannah? Are you in there?
Klar! Come in, Kapitän!
Hannah! Is that a guitar?
Ja! You seem surprised again...
I guess I am a little bit. I thought you only sang.
Nein, nein, I play a little too. Everyone always acts as if it's this shocking thing. A Belle can have more than one hobby, you know?
Of that, I have no doubt.
Do you play any instruments, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Basically all of them!
Maybe one or two.
I am tone deaf. I'd have no idea what to do if you handed me a kazoo.

Fields.DialogueText: Whoa! I'm jealous of your talent.
That's still impressive. You'd be surprised how many people can't play anything.
My hearing isn't great, but I still play.
Captain, the Morganas are back! You're needed on the bridge!
Let's go, Hannah.
Should I bring the guitar? So als Begleitung...
No.
Fine...
@BATTLE
Hannah! Am I going to get to hear you play your guitar again anytime soon?
Guitar? What are you talking about? I don't play guitar.
You... don't remember me walking in on you?
Walking in on me doing what? Certainly not playing the guitar. Ich habe gar keine Gitarre!

Fields.MenuText: Oh, all right... I guess it must've been a dream, then. I'm sorry for the misunderstanding.
No, I definitely saw you!
All right, I see what you're doing. Fine, I'll stop talking about it.

Fields.DialogueText: You dream about me playing the guitar? That's not strange at all.
Hmm, I don't think so. I think I would know if I could play a musical instrument.
What am I doing? Telling you the truth?
How would I even be able to play the guitar? I'm not a creative person, after all...
That's not what I said and you know it!
Heh. Oh! A group of Nixen was just spotted! Come on, Kapitän. Why don't you ask them if they play the guitar too?
For the love of...
@BATTLE
Hannah! I didn't expect to see you down here in the galley.
Well, I do need to eat sometimes. Damn, I could really go for a good curry right now.
Curry? That's not the most German food...
I can't just eat Bratwurst all the time, Kapitän. That would just be ridiculous. Fischbrötchen, though... I could eat them all the time.

Fields.MenuText: I'd really love some Chinese food... or maybe Japanese.
I always miss Italian food while I'm out at sea.
I could go for some classic American food right now. A burger, maybe some fries.

Fields.DialogueText: They have Fischbrötchen in Japan too, you know. Just with rice instead of bread.
Keep talking and I will mysteriously change course immediately.
They actually eat Bürger?
There are so many things we give up when we're out at sea.
Nothing that important. We still have bland food, water, camaraderie – what else do you need?
Fair point.
The Morganas have returned! Captain, we need a battle plan!
And I need for these Morganas to stop bothering me! All right, let's head up to the deck. Everyone, move!
@BATTLE
It looks like there's a mighty storm coming in from the west. We need to start getting ready!
Kapitän!
Hannah! Where do you think you're going?!
Keller?
There's a storm coming! Aren't you the least bit worried?
Pah, das bisschen Wind! It will pass soon.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not letting you go down to the engine room and that's final!
I guess you're right. Have fun down there!
Just be careful, all right?

Fields.DialogueText: What are you, meine Mutter?
I most definitely will!
Ja ja, zum Abendessen bin ich wieder da. Ha! I'll be fine, Kapitän!
I'm just a little worried about you.
You have other things to worry about. Like those Nixen over there! Auf geht's! Let's get into position!
@BATTLE
And let's hope the storm clears up before the shooting starts.
Hannah!
Mhm...
Mhm? What was that? You don't care enough to say "hello" anymore?
Hallo.
All right, now you're just being rude. What's with the cold shoulder?
Lass mich einfach in den Keller.

Fields.MenuText: I'll let you go as soon as you tell me what's going on.
If you really need to get there that badly, just go...
Why won't you tell me what's wrong?

Fields.DialogueText: Or you can just let me go now!
Danke...
Ist doch egal. Just let me go.
You can just go... but right now, we need to take care of these Morganas.
Mhm...
@BATTLE
Aah! Kapitän, you scared me!
I'm sorry! I thought you saw me!
I didn't. I was lost in my own little world.
You do always seem to be so happy down here.
I'm in my element in the Maschinenraum!
Are you doing all right, Hannah? Are you happy?
The real question is, are you happy, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Of course I'm happy! Why wouldn't I be?
Eh... that's a long, complicated story.
... I'm trying to be.

Fields.DialogueText: The world is a cruel place...
Well, we have some time.
Why don't you tell me about that journey to find happiness?
Stop trying to avoid the question!
Captain, Hans! There's a fleet of Morganas rapidly approaching!
Na dann. It's not like we were talking about anything important anyway...
@BATTLE
Are you ever happy, Hannah?
Was? Where did you just come from?!
Please answer my question. Are you ever happy?
Natürlich. Don't ask such ridiculous questions.
Hannah... in general, are you happy?
Jetzt gerade, ja. Whenever I get upset, I just go down to the Maschinenraum to work.
Is that why you're always so anxious to get down to the engine room whenever I see you?
It's the only place I can calm down. Do you have any place like that?

Fields.MenuText: If one of the crow's nests are empty, I like to sit up there. It feels like I'm on top of the world.
I like to be alone in my office. For some reason, it's so relaxing to just sit and work.
I like to sit in the galley. The smell of food is therapeutic.

Fields.DialogueText: I've always wanted to go up there, but I've never actually done so.
Working on an engine is one thing, but paperwork? How does that not stress you out?
Food is the solution to every problem, heh.
*ALARM*
Well, so much for relaxation.
You're not kidding.
@BATTLE
Hannah! Are you going down to the engine room?
Ja. Of course I am.
Why don't you try staying here and talking about what's bothering you? It might be good to have some other coping methods.
I don't know if I can just share my feelings like that...
I promise it'll stay between the two of us. We're friends, aren't we?
Klar.
I've overheard some of the Mannschaft complaining about my personality. They say that either I keep to myself, or I yell at them, with nothing in between.

Fields.MenuText: You are a little bit like that.
That's terrible! I didn't know that this was a problem on my ship.
I should have a talk with them.

Fields.DialogueText: Was? You're not serious, right? I can be personable.
Geht so. I'm probably just making a big deal out of it.
Nein. Don't do that, Kapitän, bitte.
Still, it didn't help my general feelings of... uh... loneliness, aboard this ship.
You know I'm your friend, don't you, Hannah?
Ja, I know you're my friend. Danke, Kapitän.
And I always will be.
*ALARM*
And, of course, the Morganas will always be here for you as well. They're not worthy of your friendship, though!
Nicht wahr?
@BATTLE
Hello, Kapitän! Want to come relax for a minute and share a Bier?
Sure, I could use some relaxation time right now.
Do you think we all have a place in the universe?
Ha, that's a heavy question for relaxation time, Hannah.
What do you think, though?

Fields.MenuText: We all must have some sort of place or purpose in the universe. Otherwise, why would we exist?
I don't think it's necessary for us to have a place in the universe. Modern culture makes it seem so important that we have some direction in life, but I don't think it's that relevant.
I honestly don't think we have any sort of purpose. It seems a little too convenient that our atoms exist in this perfect way, in a perfect environment. What if this is all just an accident?

Fields.DialogueText: If true, that would be very comforting.
That's true. Maybe we create our own path.
That really makes me uncomfortable, but I appreciate your openness.
Remember, I'm only a captain. What do I know?
As far as this topic is concerned, no more or less than anyone else, schätz' ich mal.
Think the Morganas have any hidden knowledge on the subject?
Only lies.
@BATTLE
Hannah! Are you doing all right? You don't look too happy.
I guess I'm... all right.
Really? That wasn't the most convincing answer.
Fine, fine... I was just working down in the engine room, and I'm getting a little bored. As calming as it is, every maintenance routine comes irgendwann to an end.
So what are you suggesting?
I want to start a new project. Mit dir.
With me?! I don't know if I have the time...
Bitte, Kapitän! Please? It would mean so much to me.

Fields.MenuText: I can't say no to you. Let's do it.
Maybe... you have to think of it, though!
I'm just so busy right now, Hannah.

Fields.DialogueText: Jawohl! We must start planning immediately!
Where's the fun in that? You need to help too!
Ausrede! You need to help too!
All right, fine. When should we start?
I'd like to start now, but it looks like there's a boatload of Nixen headed our way.
We'll pick another time, then. Let's go!
@BATTLE
I really appreciate everyone being on time for today's meeting.
Hannah, I'm the only other one here.
Das war ein Witz. I wanted to start this off by trying to decide what we're going to build.
You don't already have some great idea?
Not really... do you?

Fields.MenuText: A teleportation machine?
How about a wireless telephone?
What if we make some sort of... I don't know, some sort of system where you can acquire the answer to any question you might have?

Fields.DialogueText: That's ridiculous! That's never going to happen.
We already have Funkgeräte, you know?
Lexika. Kapitän, those already exist.
If you don't like my idea, then why don't you tell me some of yours?
I already told you, I don't have any!
Sorry for interrupting the conversation, but I just spotted a group of Morganas approaching our ship! We need to prepare for battle!
What are we waiting for? Let's get up the deck!
@BATTLE
I need everyone over here! The Morganas are back and we need to take care of them!
@BATTLE
Whoa, Hannah! Where are you off to so fast?
Keine Zeit! Muss weg! I'm meeting with someone and I don't want to be late!
Oh, all right. Have fun! Don't trip!
Whaaa!
I just said not to trip! Are you all right?
Ja, ja. I just wish I hadn't dropped all this stuff...
Here, why don't I help you? The contents of this map case went everywhere. So many tiny parts and... are these sketches for inventions?
Nein! Don't look at those!
These drawings are... amazing. Why didn't you tell me about them before?
They're just little Kritzeleien.
Why don't we just use one of these for our invention?
Na schön, hab's eilig. Pick a number between one and three.

Fields.MenuText: One!
Two!
Three!

Fields.DialogueText: Hm, interessant.
Na schön...
Oh weh.
I know which one we're doing now. I would tell you, but I really have to go. Tschüß, Käpt'n!
Hannah! Can I finally know what we're going to be building?
Ruhig, Käpt'n.
I have been calm! I've waited for so long! I can't wait another second.
Na schön, schließlich sollst du mir ja helfen. Based on the number you picked, we're going to be building a Teleskop.

Fields.MenuText: A telescope? It would be nice to have one here on board.
Don't we already have a telescope on board?
A telescope? Isn't that boring? I thought you wanted to move away from the boring.

Fields.DialogueText: The Mannschaft might even enjoy it. Es wird besonders ausgebufft.
Not one this fancy.
Just wait until you see this telescope, Kapitän. Es wird besonders ausgebufft.
Can we start now? I'm getting excited.
Well, I need to collect all the necessary parts first, and then...
Captain! We need you! The Morganas are surrounding us!
Quick! Sound the alarm, Hannah!
Ja, ja, ja...
@BATTLE
Kapitän, I need you to hand me die Knarre.

Fields.MenuText: ... What's that?
I believe that's this one...
Right here!

Fields.DialogueText: That wrench that doesn't look like one. In the box over there.
Fast, but not quite. Good try, though!
Danke! Aber... where is the Nuss?
So... why didn't you show me those drawings?
Och, nöö. Not this again! Why does it matter so much?
Because they were quite good and you never mentioned them.
I guess I'm just so used to working alone that I've lost my ability to interact with people, heh.
You should try putting yourself out there more, and you'd be surprised at how many friends you'd make just by speaking up. Have some confidence in your work!
Yes, but out there are people.
Say the words we discussed.
"My name is Hannah, and I am a confident young woman!"
You got that right! Come on, let's put our project to the side for now and help you meet some new people.
The Morganas have been spotted, Captain!
Maybe you can introduce yourself to them, then. New friends for everyone!
Klar! From wrench wench to traitor to executed. You're hilarious, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
I'm so tired... I know you wanted to test out the telescope, but does it really have to be right this second?
Ja! This is the best time to work on the Kalibrierung. We waited for these conditions, and I don't know how much longer it will be clear...
*sigh*
Stell dich nicht so an, Kapitän. I know what I'm doing.
Whatever you say...
Wow! The Teleskop works like a dream! Look at all those stars up there! There's at least... ten!

Fields.MenuText: Um, Hannah? I think there's a lot more than ten...
Maybe even eleven.
How much of an effort did you really make to count?

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitän, it was just a joke.
Tja, who knows?
Ähm, about five seconds' worth.
We probably just have a little bit more work to do and then we'll be done! I'm so proud of us.
It looks like the Nixen are, too! They're coming to congratulate us!
Carefully put the telescope away so it isn't damaged. Everyone else, get to your battle stations!
@BATTLE
Also gut... so basically, all we have to do now is add the finishing touches.
I thought that's what we were doing an hour ago!
Ooh, are you getting bored, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: We've just been working on this for quite a while... I thought we would be done by now.
Never! I'm just so excited to finally see the finished product.
Yes! I'm so bored!

Fields.DialogueText: Ich auch, but amazing creations like this one tend to take some time.
Ich auch! I just get more and more anxious the closer we are to being done.
Halt durch, Käpt'n.
Kapitän, if you want, I can just finish this up by myself.
Never. I'm going to stick by your side through the end.
All for one, and one for all?
Not really sure how that's applicable... but sure!
Die drei Musketiere! Except, there are only two of us...
Friends, now and forever! ... Damn it, look. The Morganas are back! I feel like they're just hellbent on destroying our work. Make sure it's in a safe place. Prepare for battle!
@BATTLE
Käpt'n, pass auf! Don't slip on that grease!
Woah! Oh, thanks, Hannah. That was a close one.
Naja, don't be too thankful. That's my grease you almost slipped on.
No way, what? The grease was yours?! The grease from the girl who spends all her time in the engine room? I never would have thought!
I can't tell if that was supposed to be sarcastic or... I don't know, I'm just so sorry!

Fields.MenuText: Forget about it! I don't want you to worry. No harm done.
I'm not going to lie, you did give me a good scare there. Let's try not to go dripping grease everywhere anymore, all right?
If you were anyone else, I would've gotten so angry, but I could never stay mad at you.

Fields.DialogueText: You're too kind, Käpt'n.
I swear I was just on my way to clean me up. I'm surprised you're not angrier with me.
Nein! Don't give me any special treatment! Get mad at me!
Don't be silly, you're too good a friend. I just want you to be careful, especially since it looks like there are Morganas on the prowl.
@BATTLE
Look at it... just take it all in. Isn't this the most amazing Teleskop you've ever seen?
It really is. It's incredible.
Can you believe we did this all by ourselves?
Honestly, no. When we first started, I didn't even think we would be able to finish.
Oh! We should start our own little Erfinderwerkstatt.

Fields.MenuText: You know, I like the sound of that.
Whoa, whoa, whoa! Let's slow down a little bit.
Well... I guess we'll have to see.

Fields.DialogueText: We could work out of our ship! Die schwimmenden Mechaniker!
If we want to start a workshop, we have to use the Momentum! There's not time to slow down!
Na schön, Käpt'n. I'll start planning and come to you when I have more solid ideas.
I admit, we make a great team.
Absolutely! If we make any profit, we can donate half of it to the DGzRS and the other half we can spend on the ship. That way we don't make profit and don't get into trouble.
Captain! Port's coming into view!
Understood!
Ready to guide us in, Hannah?
Allzeit bereit.
That's a stupid name, but we'll come up with the specifics later.
